page.title: 13BULCOTE-FARMING-LAND USE
page.content: Bulcote Farm is the largest farm in our area.It was originally built at the turn of the century as a breeding centre for horses for Nottingham City Corporation. The farm is 800 acres in size and it runs from Stoke Bardolph to Gunthorpe and along the River Trent to the railway lines.The Severn Trent Water Authority owns the land.The farm is special because treated sewage is pumped through pipes on to the fields and used to fertilise the grass. The farm mostly grows grass,winter wheat,winter barley and 280 acres of maize to make into silage for the 485 cow dairy herd.It also has 80-90 acres of fodderbeet which is fed to the cows in winter.
